intro: Aquilegia dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored columbine, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that come in shades of red, purple, and white, with two distinct colors on each petal. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in native ecosystems.
